articles.title: Vaccines May Not Work on New Mutant Strain of Coronavirus Spreading in US and Europe – Study - Science Times
articles.description: A newly discovered coronavirus mutation may be "immune" to vaccines currently being tested. It is of urgent concern to the medical community, which is searching for a vaccine that will work against COVID-19.

articles.author: A. Bauman and L. Shepherd and M. Ding
articles.title: Scientists Are Investigating Whether Nicotine Protects Against Coronavirus - Gizmodo Australia
articles.description: If you noticed headlines recently suggesting smoking could protect against COVID-19, you might have been surprised....
articles.content:
If you noticed headlines recently suggesting smoking could protect against COVID-19, you might have been surprised.
Smokers seem less likely than non-smokers to fall ill with coronavirus Nicotine may play an indirect role that makes it harder for the virus t… [+6845 chars]

articles.author: AFP
articles.title: 'This is stupid': 'COVID-19 parties' linked to sharp rise in cases - Yahoo News Australia
articles.description: Health authorities have lambasted 'bring your own COVID-19' parties where guests intentionally mingle with those who have tested positive.
articles.content:
There has been a reported rise in so-called COVID-19 parties in Washington state in the US where non infected guests mingle with those who have tested positive for coronavirus, with the aim of catching and overcoming the virus.
Health officials in the northw… [+2920 chars]

articles.title: Short interruptions to sitting time can boost mental health - Mirage News
articles.description: TV binges aren't good for our mental health, but a new study shows we can halve the negative impacts by getting up off the couch more often in between...
articles.content:
TV binges aren’t good for our mental health, but a new study shows we can halve the negative impacts by getting up off the couch more often in between episodes or in ad breaks.
A new study from the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute and international collabo… [+3636 chars]

articles.author: AAP
articles.title: SA Health fears 'hidden pandemic' - 9News
articles.description: A South Australian parliamentary inquiry has heard health officials fear people are not presenting for other serious issues during the COVID-19 pandemic.
